text: When denominators are the same, the fraction with the larger numerator is greater. Example: 3/8 < 5/8.
Think of 8 equal slices of a pizza. 5/8 means 5 slices, 3/8 means 3 slices. 5 slices is more.
Misconception: thinking 3/8 > 5/8 because 3>5 is false; the denominator is the same, compare numerators.
Try this: Which is bigger, 2/5 or 4/5? Since both have 5 as the denominator, compare 2 and 4. 4 is bigger, so 4/5 is bigger.
Real world example: If you and your friend each have chocolate bars divided into 6 pieces, and you eat 2/6 while your friend eats 5/6, who ate more? Your friend did!
